name: Tena Fleming
text: The Mt. Olive Senior Center is a great place for community seniors to pick up a hot meal that includes a meat, veggies, milk, juice, fruit, bread, butter & dessert. It’s convenient to drive around and a nice gentleman brings it out to your car carry out style around 11:00 AM weekdays. It’s provided at a reduced rate so you need to sign up so the correct amount of food can be prepared. The forms are available at the center or visit the website.  The Seniors used to meet daily for activities but this has stopped due to COVID presently.  The Senior Center is also available to rent for events.

text: Wow! What an amazing place for seniors to connect and stay active. Plenty of things to do to satiate every personality! Definitely an exceptional facility!

name: Ken Walters
text: Great place for Seniors to meet. Must live in Shelby to become a member. Beautiful building and grounds, with friendly and professional people who work there and maintain the facilities.

name: Alicia Kenerley
text: They overbooked an art class I had already paid for and refused to give me back my money. One never knows if they're going to be allowed in because of the train delays and the people at the front desk don't care and turn elderly people away. The facility is a small fraction of the size of Pelham's Senior Center and the administrators at Pelham really care about seniors rather than collecting our money and sadistically turning us away when it isn't our fault the place gets blocked by trains or that they overbook classes. With the postage stamp size of the bldg one would think they could extend hours to offer more classes, but nope.

name: Janice Claus
text: This my home away from home. We have a great time.

text: Everyone there is so friendly and helpful. Has to b the best Senior Center anywhere. Aleysa always keeps the center  hopping and full of new and exciting programs and trips.

name: vanessa brown
text: My Dad considered this facility. We chose a different one. He needed more care than this one provided. This facility is more for seniors who are able to prepare their own meals and don't need as much support. The facility doesn't provide 3 meals per day and does not have an RN for every shift. IMO, if the senior is in reasonably good health and just needs an occasional "look in", then it could be fine. I felt as the seniors needed more help with daily living activities then that's when the facility really makes their money. I will be honest and say these are my opinions and everyone knows what that means. The 2 bedroom apartment was nice esthetically,  the staff seemed nice. It just wasn't a fit for my parent. My objective in this post was the photos of the apartment. Hopefully it helps someone.

name: Anthony Bowen Sr.
text: I have been living here since August 16, 2019 and I find this is like my best place to reside and it’s a great place to live. I plan to be here for a long time.

name: Cynthia Lee
text: BEWARE OF THIS PLACE!! My father lived here and do to health reasons needed to be transferred to a nursing home. We gave the notice to Brookdale and moved him out. Two months later they drafted 1640.00 from his bank account!!!! AFTER he was no longer a resident for two solid months!! Now they are refusing to give his money back and we can't afford to pay his nursing home for the month. They are shady and all about money. They are not honest and will take advantage once they have your bank account information. I recommend going somewhere else to a place that has integrity. BEWARE OF THIS PLACE!!!!

resp.text:
Cynthia,

We are aware you have spoken to the executive director regarding this matter. Our district director of operations also left a message for you, and we encourage you to call her back if you wish to further discuss.

name: Laron Hardy
text: My mother has been at Brookdale Cedar Springs for almost a year, and we couldn't be happier.  I would highly recommend Cedar Springs.

resp.text: Thank you Gail!  We love having you on our team!

text: The staff at The Gardens of Waterford are so helpful and knowledgeable in helping with placement of senior adults. I highly recommend The Gardens of Waterford for anyone seeking placement for their loved one with dementia needing assisted living. It is An open and airy facility. Happy and bright.

name: Felicia Lamar
text: A great place missing everyone

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review, Felicia. We appreciate your supportive feedback!

name: Elizabeth Haupt-Johnson
text: Staff and residents’ families communicate well with each other which has created trusting relationships and a pleasant home for residents!❤️

name: Monica A.
text: The resident's at The Gardens of Waterford are well taken care of each and every single day. All residents are visually healthy and beautifully groomed. The management team upholds a very professional and responsible duty to each resident and employee. When working at The Gardens of Waterford you must have  purpose. All residents at The Gardens of Waterford have a special Dx: that takes love, patience,  and kindness. Each second, each minute,  and each hour takes time. If you're seeking employment  at The Gardens of Waterford make note you must have #Purpose and you must have patience every single day. I am grateful for my time spent at The Gardens of Waterford.  I've  learned so much about memory care.  My future plans as a Holistic Nurse Practitioner is to work closely with Doctors and Nurse Practitioners around the world that are trying to eradicate #Alzheimer's

name: Robin Rudder
text: Such a wonderful staff who provides a caring environment for our loved one.

resp.text: Robin, Thank you for the five star review.

name: Tina Whitaker
text:
Loving community
Clean
Management team is very responsive

resp.text: Thank you Tina for the 5-star review.

name: Lori J
text: One year ago this was the best of the best in Montgomery.  Today, it's a disaster.  Management change months ago and Manor House has gone so far down hill that we now, for our family member's safety, have to leave.  The head nurse has no compassion.  The director is unfit to run a community.  She asked us to give her a chance and we did, what choice did we have.  She has no regional support.  The corporate office makes a lot of unfulfilled promises.

resp.text: Lori, we take our reviews seriously and would like to discuss this further. Please call our toll-free Human Resources Hotline at 1-855-273-4397 for staff-related issues, or the Resident Relations Hotline at 1-855-881-2576. Thank you.

name: Sandy Cloud
text: Negatively, We signed up as us older people do.  Then used their insurance company the Hartford.  Driving down the highway windy day something flew up out of ditch that I ran over and tore up front end of my car.  The adjuster put me at fault collision.  They went up significantly on our multi car policies.  Tried talking to them with no help so we could not afford to renew a years policy and had to seek other insurance February 2020.  August of this year the Hartford sent us a $800 some dollars bill and they were cancelling our insurance.  Called them starting with AARP who they are thru- transferred 4 times where I informed their representative we did not renew and was forced to seek other insurance.  About a week or so later got letters from DMV they couldn’t verify our insurance.  The nerve of a large company sending us a large bill during this pandemic then notify the DMV like we really didn’t have coverage to me is just shameful way to treat people.  Would highly not recommend using them.

text: Wasted  my. Time I am in great need of help payingy power billy daughter was in a domestic violence marriage whge her husband left he cleared out both of her accounts and we are having trouble catching up because we get paid once a month they are going to cut our. Power off the 26th of October

name: Nancy Jones
text: They take care of their people

name: Vicki Seals
text: A very caring ministry.

name: Paul Flynn
text: Visiting  Angels has been nothing short of amazing! The owners are wonderful. I had the opportunity to meet both Amy & Jeremy. Amy runs the Florence office while her husband operates Huntsville. They both really take the time to match the client with the best caregiver to not only meet their needs but personality too. Amy strives to make sure her employees can reach her anytime day/night, holidays, weekends etc. Everyone is very helpful & easy to work with. Taking time off is never an issue. Everyone works together to ensure coverage is met. I had an unexpected hospital admission at 3 in the morning & calling in to find coverage at that hour wasn't an issue. I was hospitalized for nearly a week. Amy was so supportive. Never had I had such an attentive boss. I can say for my part that I view her as not only my employer but also a friend.

name: Debbie Garrett
text:
I’ve been a caregiver for many years.   When we moved to Athens a couple months ago I felt it time to get back to what I love...caring for the elderly!
Working with Amy and Jeremy has been a very nice experience!!!   They are kind and understanding of scheduling issues we as caregivers may have.   While I’ve only been with Visiting Angels of Florence for a short time,  I already feel blessed to be part of the team to provide the best care to our elderly clients as possible!!!

name: Lindsey Watford
text: The owners, Amy and Jeremy, really go above and beyond to make sure their clients have all of their needs covered. I have personally witnessed them both take time away from their own families and personal lives to put the needs of the client first. You couldn’t ask for a better company to take care of your loved one.

name: Stacey Ronillo
text: The caregivers and office staff at Visiting Angels were amazing to my mother(and helped us as well really).  We are so please to have used such a wonderful, caring and compassionate company when mom needed a little extra help.  Thank you!

resp.text: It was our pleasure!  Thank you for choosing Visiting Angels and writing such a nice review!

name: Shirley Vickery
text:
My Mom will be moving in to Regency Pointe in a few weeks and our entire family has been so happy with the experience.  We have been on the waiting list for several months so Stephanie has shown the facility multiple times to different groups of family members always with a smile.

We visited every available establishment for senior living in the Birmingham area and were about to give up when Mom found her new home.  We look forward to a new beginning for her.

name: Derriel Anderson
text: Have been moving tenants in and out since Regency Pointe since it first opened! Gr8 Staff and cleaning crew, and maintenance, Always really cheerfull employees!  ***** star rating!!!

name: Jude Forsyth
text:
Stopped in to see how this senior center is coming back from Covid. As usual the staff is very helpful. There are some classes now. Call for current info.
The cafeteria is still not open. The fitness center is and you should call them to find out more about using it.
Remember you must be registered to use this facility and you can do this at the reception desk. Then use your chip card and swipe in each time you come in. You must also have their doctor's form filled out once a year to use the fitness center or thermal pool.
Seniors are so lucky to have this facility and others like it.

name: SANDY FAIRLEY
text: I love this place. They are closed now because of Covid19. But when they were open, I enjoyed the gym, the art class, the pool room, and the dance  classes. They even have a cafeteria that's open to the public. They have a hot pool, and clean shower rooms with lockers. There is always something going on here and other events at different locations. Once you sign up you're allowed to visit all the other centers and participate there also.

name: William Tackett
text: Just voted. Did not eat but cafe open. Smelled good!

name: Roy Davis
text: The food was very good and the facilities were clean.

name: Ivan Boatwright
text: There are classes for writing, dancing, bowling, ( virtual) and so many more. It is clean, well taken care of and staff go out of their way to help. I do weight lifting and writing classes as well as I eat there every day. Price for food is 6.50 or 5.75 if you purchase coupons in advance. They do not go bad , useable any day. It is much better than my cooking or eating out at most fast food and most restaurants.

name: Doris Fontana
text: Love the wayercolor class on Tuesdays. ..the highlight of my week.  Lunches are great.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Highly recommend the it.

name: Rebecca Jett
text: Seems like a nice facility for the seniors in our area.  The MPL Bookmobile visits, there are benches outside, lots of club and activity meetings...makes me look forward to my golden years!

name: Peggy waters
text:
Always a good experience at the Connie Hudson Senior Center.  It is VERY clean and every worker is VERY FRIENDLY!!
The work out room is equipped nicely.  My husband and I eat their frequently and the food is reasonable and tastes wonderful!!!!  We really appreciate our Senior Center !!!!

name: William “Bill” Benbow
text: Great times all the time. Ashley-Nicole is awesome and so are her staff: Doris, Adam, Montez, and the front desk staff all the way to the front desk meet and greeters. Offers pick-up and take home .

text: I have family members who have lived at Cedar Hill. It is a wonderful facility. The care and concern shown for them has been absolutely wonderful! Their health care is always stellar as well as the cleanliness. The activities provided via staff and community members is awesome Not one time in last 10 years have I ever had a concern of their well being.

text: Our visit was very nice , the gated facility was spectacular, inside and out! Staff members were friendly and eager to help. Hope I'm fortunate enough to stay in anything close to this in the future.

text: A little to small for our church events we've had there (wedding and graduation receptions,Christmas dinners,go-away parties and etc.) also limited parking with groups over at least 30-40 but more available parking at nearby fire station and Town hall parking lot.The kitchen is very nice and available chairs amd tables for your events.Also a plus that there's a Dollar General across the street for last minute forgotten items :) Bottom line great place for smaller events.

name: Carleatha Cunningham
text: Visiting Angels is great place to work for. They are very friendly staff and supervisors. I have been with them over 3 years. I wouldn’t trade my job for anything. Best place to work. We also provide the best care your love ones need. We treat them as they are family to us.

name: Stephanie Bennett
text: I've used Visiting Angel's in the care of my 81 year old dad. There was so much genuine care given. I  was glad to see this in this day and age. They were not just there because it was their job but they truly cared about the patient,  the family as well as their duties.  I would recommend  Visiting Angel's to others.

name: Amy Self
text: I started working with visiting Angel's a few weeks ago. The application was easy yet thorough. They try to match caregivers and clients so there is a seamless relationship. I love the company.

name: Elizabeth Boyd
text: Visiting Angels is a wonderful company to work for! Russell is an amazing employer and puts his heart into his company. His compassion and love for our elderly shows in how he runs his company from day to day! He is an advocate for his caregivers that work for him as well as the clients we assist! I have worked for multiple companies in the same capacity in the past but Visiting Angels in Trussville is a step above the rest!

name: David Jones
text: Visiting Angles has been a lifesaver! They have provided great caregivers for my mom and helped us through a difficult time. Special thanks to Russell and Tosha for their great work. They have always been there when we needed them.

resp.text: Thank you so much David! We appreciate you taking the time to leave us this 5 star review! We love serving your family!

name: Adrian Wilson
text: This company definitely has your best interest at heart. They care about their employees as much as they care about their clients. I have enjoyed working for this company so far.

name: Matt Johnson
text: Visiting Angels is best provider in the Birmingham area. Russell and his team are true Angels. They have an outstanding team in place to take care of our loved ones.

name: Carolyn Foster
text: Great place to work. I have worked 4 years for them. They are awesome. Office Staff is great.

name: Amy Patton
text: Russell and the staff at Visiting Angels are nothing short of amazing! We personally used Visiting Angels when my mother in law had a brain aneurysm and stroke. The caregivers worked so well with her, encouraged her to complete her physical therapy and were able to take her to doctors appointments and errands around town. They did a great job of matching caregivers that had similar interests. I would recommend Visiting Angels, they are the reason that she has made a full recovery!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave such a wonderful review! We loved serving your mother-in-law during her physical therapy!

name: Michelle Ryder
text: Great company.  Caring loving employees that are dedicated to taking the best care of your loved ones.

name: brenda varnado
text: The angel taking care of my mom  andwas gentle understanding. My mom had Alzheimer's it's a very tough desase. she was there for my mom she was there for moms animals and she was there for us. If I had to do it again I would want an angel to come stay with our family

name: James Church Nicholas
text: Very capable staff and very courteous.  They do fantastic work.

resp.text: Thank you so much James! We appreciate you!

text: Great place to work. Very rewarding  placing caregivers in client's home that have a passion to work with geriatrics and hearing how pleased the clients are when we take care of their loved ones.

resp.text: Thank you very much Susan! We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a 5-star review!

name: Logan Deen
text: I personally know Russell, who is the owner of Visiting Angels. The passion he has for his business rivals none, and he truly cares about his clients! I highly recommend Visiting Angels!

resp.text: Thank you very much!

resp.text: Thank you Bridget! We are so grateful you would take the time to write us a review!

name: Misty Black
text: I work here and have been there for almost 5 years and I love my job and residents.... There’s like my family. They get treated like family if I’m around and they all have a special place in my ❤️

name: Rhonda Perez
text: There are some wonderful people who work at Hatley Healthcare that truly care about the residents. As with most long term care facilities, staffing adequately to meet the many diverse needs of the residents is very challenging leaving front line workers to be responsible for too many residents. When staffing is “short” or inadequate, you will learn that management tells staff to “Just try to keep them dry and turned.” I put that in quotation marks because that’s what I was told by the DON and ADON when I worked there. What it meant was skip showers, bed baths, getting residents up out of bed, etc ; in other words -Do the best that you can. Very hard work but somehow we, the staff would get more than the “minimal” done because “we cared”!  The best co-workers and team players I ever worked with in long term care were at Hatley Health Care. The administrative staff, however were difficult and caused many nurses undue stress. The DON and ADON were always looking for a fall guy or a way to blame others for nursing errors or mishaps. Never once did they ever realize that it was the two of them who were at the root of any problem. If the ADON told us something to do and it ended up causing problems- she would simply deny she ever said that to us. The politics of the facility is their REAL DOWNFALL there - which leads to the staffing shortages and loss of experienced nurses. But it is as if they thrive on it! Family owned and managed - they do things the way they want to and are happy to do so. The level of care is good but it’s the nurses and nursing assistants that make that happen despite upper management. The Administrator is young, smart and a real go getter whom I like very much. Once the DON and ADON retire, I believe things will improve with staffing. So there’s hope!

name: Betty Mcneal
text: I like that place they take very good care of my father, they took very good care of my mother while she was there, too !!!

name: Tim Carty
text:
My sister in law was a resident there for 3 years, before that her dad was a resident for 6 years. I could not recommend any higher. The staff was always pleasant and took excellent care of them both. Betty Faye Minor, my sister in law passed this morning. Her only wish was to go back to Hatley's. She loved it there and wanted to see her friends, residents and staff were included. I hope Hatley's recognizes their wonderful staff. I would love to call each and everyone of you by name. The list is long and I'm afraid I would leave someone out. They know who they are. Thanks so much for your devoted care and honest love shown. Much respect to everyone and please realize you have not gone unnoticed. With kindest respect,
Thank You

name: Alicia E Lester
text: Amazing people great staff really professional why my grandmother stay there they were really good to us even after she passed away

name: Stuart Herring
text: Hatley's is short on staff -- they're competing with the local hospital for skilled workers. The ones I've interacted with are friendly and competent, though some of them at the facility should "up their game" when lifting and handling residents.

name: Martha Barnett
text:
Clean.My sister is at Harley Health Care.She has been there a year and a half.
I have no complaints except the food is not always suitable to her.
God has been good to her.
God bless the patients,their families,the employees and their families.

name: Melisa Smith
text: Very clean for a nursing home. The dementia unit is the place I visited and everyone was supportive and nice with the patients that I witnessed. Really hope they stay this attentive and nice.

name: Dominique Smith
text: This is just a wonderful place. They have some of the most responsible people's.  An my wife have work there for 3 years now. An she loves it

name: Raymond Davis
text: Was looking for a home for my mother and visited Harley. Everyone was very nice and assisted me with all paperwork needed. My mother is very happy and enjoys the facility.

name: Kate Austin
text: I called and left messages with their head of admissions and front desk staff after the admissions manager was unresponsive. I asked specific questions and left detailed voicemail messages. No one ever returned my calls about an extremely dire situation. Now my father is recovering at his place of residence ALONE after a serious surgery. They obviously do not care in the least, so I'd be extremely weary of leaving anybody to recover under their care. If you are in need of an effective and caring admissions manager- feel free to contact me. This is not how business should run or how healthcare should be viewed. Thanks.

name: Charlotte Mims
text: The administration needs a lot of improvement! I would not recommend placing your loved ones there if you can help it. I will not encourage anyone I know to go to work for this private organization. I personally know there are some good nurses who work there, but there organization is not organized at all. In my opinion the priorities need to be revamped by far. There is neglect that goes on in the facility and untrained CNA's doing things they are not trained to do. Watch after your family members closely. And, whatever you do watch your back as a trainee/employee. They do not care about your investment in the company, nor do they care about your career goals as an individual. You may give 110%, but the organization will not notice due to the immature acts of their staff and the unprofessional ism from the administration. Good luck to all who currently dealing with this organization.

name: Bob Free
text: Don,t know this place

name: Michael Schmidt
text: My Mom was a resident of memory care at The Blake for several years before her passing  in July 2020. Though initially it was tough transitioning her from her home to a care facility (she was a strong-willed even WITH  dementia!), she adjusted thanks to the love and care she received. I never regretted my decision. Kudos the Director John Michael, the management team and the entire group of caregivers. I never worried about Mom's safety or well-being while she lived at The Blake. Thank you for making her part of the family and for my peace-of-mind!

resp.text: Michael, thank you so much for leaving this wonderful review and sharing your experience with our community. It was such an honor and privilege to have your mother as one of our residents and as part of the family here. We will pass along your kind words to our team, and always feel free to reach out if you need anything in the future. Take care!

name: Claudia Daniel
text:
Our mom arrived at the Blake at Malbis pretty much kicking and screaming. Much different story now, she is happy,  calm,  and grateful that she doesn’t have to worry about her house upkeep anymore.
Her major adjustment took about 3 to 4 weeks.
John Micheal, the executive director is almost always able to talk when I have a question, so is the rest of the staff, they have all been so helpful and kind.
Bonnie and the other ladies who answer the phone are knowledgeable, helpful and friendly.
The nursing staff are the best by far, I consider them like friends and so does my wonderful mom.
Mom loves the food and keeps saying her pants are to tight now!
The activities director, Petra, always has something going on, right now she is putting together a grandparents day treat for the residents.
John Michael has kept the family current with all updates about the COVID-19. The Blake is very cautious about opening up to soon, for this I’m extremely grateful. It’s a horrible way for any loved one to pass. They have in my opinion gone out of there way to try ways for us to see our mom.
I chose The Blake for our mom 1 year ago because it felt like a home when I went on my first tour. My opinion has not changed.
We dreaded putting mom in a home, but we have been so happy, and so has she, because she is in a place that is like a home.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with our community, Claudia! Your mother is a joy to have as our resident and we most certainly appreciate your involvement as well. We're always striving to provide the best care possible for our residents and reviews like this are so great to see. We will definitely be passing along your kind words to our team.

name: Jason Smith
text: Our family had a terrible experience. I find the facility unfit to care for the elderly.

resp.text:
Hi Jason,
We want to take the chance to apologize for the negative experience you've had with our community. We'd really like to know more about your situation in order for us to improve. Please reach out to  Executive Director, Tammy Robinson, at tammy.robinson@blakeliving.com to discuss matters further.

name: Janet Norman
text: My mom suffered from dementia and short term memory loss and I tried having her live with me.  It was clear I could not provide her the care she needed.  The staff at The Blake - Malbis (memory care) loved and cared for my mother like I never expected.  Mom went on outings, participated in activities.  I visited her all times of the day throughout the week and found her well cared for and engaged in activities.  Turning over your parent to others for care is a very difficult decision but at The Blake - Malbis she was under the best care you could ask for.  The staff made a very difficult situation much easier for me and my brother.  Mom was better looked after than I was capable of doing.  Thank you everybody, especially John, Petra, and Rachel.

resp.text: Janet, we really appreciate you leaving this thoughtful review on our community. It truly means a lot to us, and we'll make sure to pass your review on for our staff to see. Taking the best possible care of our residents and offering support to family members are our top priorities, and reviews like yours reassure us we're on the correct path.

name: Rhonda Winder
text:
While our family has an overall great impression with The Blake at Malbis, we do have an experience with them that isn’t so great. They can very easily rectify matters, but so far they refuse to do so. It has to do with the beauty salon.
If you’re loved one wishes to get their hair done they may make use of the in-house salon. There is a form that the person responsible to pay the salon charges fills out. You may leave a credit card on file and you may opt to just have your card used whenever the resident wishes or be asked if you’re in agreement with your family member having their hair done before being charged. This is so that a family member who is losing their mental acuity doesn’t decide to go get their hair done too often, which was our situation, and we stipulated on the form that we’d like to be contacted first.
However, our card was charged several times with no permission request beforehand. To the tune of approximately $500.00. With our busy life we didn’t catch these charges as they were incurred. Once we did see them, we called and got them stopped.  To their credit, The Blake admitted they were in the wrong. However, it has been over a year of requesting the fraudulent charges be reversed or having a check sent to us. We’ve been in touch with the beauty salon, patient representatives, the facility manager and a regional manager. We’ve allowed each person along the way ample time to make it right, sometimes two months before we call again, but no resolution is ever forthcoming. Now, they’ve stopped taking our calls.
We will now pursue this with our credit card company.
Our family member passed away in May of 2020, so they are no longer a resident. I would hate to think that is the reason we now are not even getting our phone calls answered.
If you’re wondering why our family member passed away, it was due to the virus. We were told she was the only one in the whole facility to contract it. A subsequent email from The Blake that was emailed to families of the residents claimed to have zero cases of the virus at The Blake.
I suppose no place can be 100% above board at all times, but these things concern us.
Please don’t misunderstand us. We realize the virus is strange and can effect some and not others. We have no ill feelings in that regard. These things happen. But we would love to be treated as well as we were when she was accepted there.
We have no other complaints. The facility was a beautiful and very nice place for seniors.

resp.text:
Hi Rhonda,
First and foremost, we want to apologize that you've had this unpleasant experience. During this unprecedented time, we have made, and continue to make, it a priority to keep our residents and families as up-to-date as possible with the most accurate and timely information available to us. Additionally, we strive to partner with the best service providers in order to give our residents the highest quality services and amenities possible. We understand you have had a frustrating experience working with our previous stylist provider and we are currently working hard to reach a solution for you. We are grateful to have had the opportunity to care for your mother and we want to thank you for your trust and kind words regarding the care she received as a resident here at The Blake.

name: D Joiner
text:
I have never written an online review, but the experience we had with this facility warrants my remarks. My mother was a Memory Care resident for 2 months 25 days before removing her from this facility.  Once home she was examined by our physician along with labs received from the Blake.  She had lost approximately 20 lbs, was poorly nourished (per lab work), had a large pressure ulcer on hip (never reported by staff), cellulitis in lower extremity (never reported by staff or wasn’t being treated).  She walked in on admission and was wheelchair bound upon leaving. As I said that is the SHORT LIST of issues we had with this facility.  Don’t be fooled by the
“nice facility or friendly staff”.  My mother was neglected physically and medically.  I am not just a disgruntled daughter. I worked in critical care for years, served as nurse manager of a critical care unit and a cardiology outpatient clinic.  I know poor care when I see it!!!

resp.text:
Hi D,
We apologize that you’ve had a negative experience with our community. At The Blake, we're committed to offering the best care possible for residents, as well as support for family members. Although it’s never easy to receive reviews like these, we take them very seriously and we'd like to resolve any issues you've had with our level of care. If you'd like to discuss these matters further, please contact our Executive Director, John Michael, at john.michael@blakeliving.com.

name: Sam Adams
text: Our only problem with The Blake, is information, few of the staff will give out info. In particular our Dad,(93 yrs.) was admitted during covid 19 and quarantined until negative test result, we were told 2 days to get result, after 5 days we questioned why no result, after a full fay and multiple calls we were then told 3 days in quarantine before test is even performed. Not veryhvery

resp.text:
Hello Sam,
We sincerely apologize for your frustrating experience; we know how stressful a delay in receiving information can be, especially in times like these. Also we want to thank you for your support and patience as we navigate through these unprecedented challenges.  We would like to reach out to see how can better improve this process, so this isn't repeated in the future. Please contact us at (251) 625-6400, so we can discuss this matter further.

name: Brad Hinman
text: My Mom has been in several assisted living facilities over the years and this is the best! Highly recommend...

name: Susan Holmes
text: My Dad lasted a total of 45 hours in their Memory Care facility. During that time he fell 3 times. They said he was physically aggressive and called an ambulance to take him to the hospital. They only way we knew this was - the hospital called for information.  If he became angry, and he might have, it was because he was scared!  However, 2 hours later when the ambulance did arrive, he was asleep in his chair.  He is now in the hospital with pneumonia.  These residents are not safe! Oh! ...and I had left him a gift bag with a variety of items the first day.  We never found it!

resp.text:
Hello Susan-
We would like to sincerely apologize for your experience at our beloved community. As resident care and employee support are our top priorities at the Blake, we take these comments very seriously. John Michael, our Executive Director, would love to speak with you further about your experience. Please call (251) 625-6400 to reach him. Again we appreciate your comments and apologize for the negative experience.

name: Natalie Davis
text: Prior to working at The Blake, I worked WITH The Blake. They truly care about the residents and their families. It is a beautiful community, the food is great, and it is a fun place to be. I would most definitely place my family here when the time comes.

name: Jerre Brisky
text: Wonderful and gorgeous facility.

name: Crooked Smile
text: Great

name: Sheila Emerson
text: Nice peopls

name: Lallie Lucas
text: Good to have events

name: Clayton Garth
text: Baby shower
